The term 'Octanol' usually refers to the isomer, octan-1-ol, with the molecular
formula CH 3(CH 2) 7OH. It is a fatty alcohol.
Many other isomers are also known. Esters of octanol, such as octyl acetate,
occur as components of essential oils. Octanol is manufactured for the synthesis
of esters for use in perfumes and flavorings. It is used to model the
partitioning of pharmaceutical products between water and the cytosol. Other
uses include experimental medical procedures for controlling Essential Tremor
and other types of involuntary neurological tremors.
